etymology.description: 混(混) (hùn, 'mix') + 血(血) (xuè, 'blood') = mix blood -> mixed blood
etymology.interpretation: The term 混血(混血) (hùnxuè, 'mixed blood') describes a person of mixed racial or ethnic ancestry. It emphasizes the concept of blending different 'bloodlines' or heritages, highlighting the diversity and combination of different genetic backgrounds.

examples.chinese: 他拥有混血的魅力(他擁有混血的魅力)。
examples.english: He has the charm of mixed blood.

examples.chinese: 他的长相别具一格(他的長相別具一格)，因为他是混血(因爲他是混血)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de zhǎngxiàng biéjù yīgé, yīnwèi tā shì hùnxuè.
examples.english: His appearance is unique because he is of mixed blood.

examples.chinese: 她在众人中脱颖而出(她在眾人中脫穎而出)，混血赋予了她异国风情(混血賦予了她異國風情)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài zhòngrén zhōng tuōyǐng ér chū, hùnxuè fùyǔ le tā yìguó fēngqíng.
examples.english: She stands out among the crowd; her mixed blood gives her an exotic charm.
